definition: Marco Polo (1254-c. 1324), Venetian trader and explorer who traveled the Silk road to China, author of Il Milione (Travels of Marco Polo)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]

sentences.chinese: 马可波罗称为煤黑石头。

sentences.english: Marco Polo's father and unde seemed to reach several lands in the East.
sentences.chinese: 马可波罗的父亲和叔叔似乎是到过东方的几个国家。

sentences.english: Marco Polo 's travelogue mentions that Kublai Khan sent envoys to Malgache .
sentences.chinese: 马可波罗游记中提到忽必烈曾派使节到过马尔加什。

sentences.english: In Marco Polo's case, the story seems to be of his own creation.
sentences.chinese: 马可波罗的故事让人们觉得仿佛是他的亲身经历一样。

sentences.english: Polo 's travelogue mentions that Kublai Khan sent envoys to Malgache.
sentences.chinese: 马可波罗游记中提到忽必烈曾派使节到过马尔加什。

definition: 秦越人[Qin2 Yue4 ren2] (407-310 BC), Warring States physician known for his medical skills, nicknamed Bian Que after the earliest known Chinese physician allegedly from the 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4] era
Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]

Diaochan (-192), one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3], in fiction a famous beauty at the break-up of Han dynasty, given as concubine to usurping warlord Dong Zhuo 董卓[Dong3 Zhuo2] to ensure his overthrow by fighting hero Lü Bu 呂布|吕布[Lu:3 Bu4]
Houyi, mythological Chinese archer whose wife was Chang'e
Hua Mulan, legendary woman warrior (c. fifth century), Northern dynasties folk hero recorded in Sui and Tang literature
Genghis Khan (1162-1227), founder and ruler of the Mongol Empire
Liu Bang (256 or 247-195 BC), bandit leader who became first Han emperor Han Gaozu 漢高祖|汉高祖 (reigned 202-195 BC)
